job_description:
About GHN
Giao Hang Nhanh (GHN) is one of Vietnam's leading logistics enterprises, confidently providing superior services: "SMARTER, FASTER, MORE COST-EFFECTIVE." We support millions of businesses in optimizing their operations and create thousands of jobs for the Vietnamese people.
Established with the mission to revolutionize the logistics industry and driven by a technology-centric development approach, GHN continuously applies advanced technological solutions to every order. This aims to streamline operational processes, enhance delivery efficiency, and provide fast, secure, and effective service experiences for all customer segments ‚Äì from e-commerce platforms and retailers to individual consumers.
With a nationwide network covering all 63 provinces and a strategy of continuous innovation alongside a robust infrastructure system, GHN has been affirming its pioneering position in the rapidly growing e-commerce and logistics sectors in Vietnam.
Why Join GHN?
This is a pivotal opportunity to join a rapidly growing e-commerce delivery leader in Vietnam, where your contributions will directly impact our strategic direction and market position. You will be part of a team that embraces cutting-edge technologies, data-driven innovation & discruption to solve real-world problems and enhance millions of lives. We offer a dynamic and collaborative environment where you can leverage your expertise, grow professionally through challenging projects, and make a significant impact on our success.
About the AI & Data Team
At GHN, our highly motivated AI & Data team is dedicated to establishing GHN as the fastest, most reliable, and convenient delivery service in Vietnam. We achieve this by developing and adopting advanced, data-driven decisions and solutions, making data capability a core business driver for operational efficiency, scalability, and customer trust and happiness.
Job Summary
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Software Engineer to join our dynamic AI & Data team. This pivotal role will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our big data collections and flows, designing scalable data pipeline architectures, and ensuring the robust integration of data for AI/ML-powered applications. The ideal candidate is an expert in big data engineering who thrives on optimizing complex data systems and building foundational infrastructure from the ground up to develop, deliver, and strengthen our AI & Data Platform. This platform is crucial for enabling all GHN‚Äôs users - employees, drivers, and customers - through advanced and robust data-driven insights and solutions. The Senior Data Engineer 2 will provide technical expertise, mentor junior team members, and collaborate closely with Data Scientists, ML Engineers, and other cross-functional teams to ensure optimal data delivery architecture and quality for ongoing AI/ML initiatives.
Key Responsibilities
Big Data Platform Design & Optimization:
Design, build, and maintain optimal big data pipeline architectures that are crucial for GHN's AI/ML solutions, ensuring high availability, scalability, and efficiency.
Develop robust ETL/ELT solutions for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of high-quality data from a wide variety of internal and external data sources (e.g., MongoDB, Postgres, e-commerce sites, social platforms).
Optimize data writing and reading performance across various database systems and data lakes to support real-time and batch processing requirements.
Make technical choices and build systems and tools to manage the entire data lifecycle of large, complex datasets.
AI/ML Data Application Integration & Development:
Collaborate closely with Data Scientists and ML Engineers to design and implement data solutions that support the development, training, and deployment of AI/ML models (e.g., demand forecasting, logistics optimization, fraud detection, customer segmentation).
Oversee and contribute to the integration of AI/ML models into the broader product infrastructure and user experience, ensuring seamless deployment and operation.
Develop and implement data pipelines specifically for AI/ML model data preparation, including feature engineering, data enrichment, backfilling, merging, deduplicating, and ensuring data compatibility and format for various model inputs.
Data Quality, Governance & Monitoring:
Implement and monitor robust data quality frameworks to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across all data sources, identifying and resolving potential issues proactively.
Design and apply data governance solutions (e.g., using Apache Ranger) to manage data access, privacy, and compliance for large-scale projects, including ensuring legal and regulatory adherence.
Build and customize metrics for monitoring and alerting tools to support incident detection and ensure the consistency and reliability of data services and pipelines.
Technical Expertise & Collaboration:
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior data engineers, fostering their professional development and promoting best practices in data engineering and AI/ML data readiness.
Work closely with cross-functional teams including Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Product Managers, to understand business requirements and translate them into robust, data-driven solutions.
Identify, design, and implement internal process enhancements through automation, optimizing data delivery and infrastructure for greater scalability and efficiency.
Stay current on published state-of-the-art big data technologies and AI/ML data engineering techniques for continuous platform improvement.

Given the growth of our enterprise both organic and through acquisitions, we are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Software Asset Management Specialist to join our Information Systems Commercial Operation team and work closely with SAM (Software Asset Management) Team. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders across various teams and departments to manage the Software and Software Services lifecycle.
As Software Asset Management Specialist, you will work proactively to:
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their SW and SW service needs,
Engage vendors to procure Software and Software services,
Ensure Vendors Software and Services are in compliance with Renesas policy and procedures.
Maintain Software and Services and be the commercial contact to vendors.

Manage Renewals / Addon requests and Retirement of solutions.
You will have the chance to work within a global organization where we consider each challenge as an opportunity, a place where you can learn, grow your capabilities, and discover your potential.

Process Improvement: Continuously evaluate and enhance SAM processes to support scalability and integration across entities.

New / Add-on / Renewal of Software and Software services agreements completed on time.

Plan and deliver monthly procurement plan for Software and Software services.

Build Dashboard and reports for Software Asset and Services

The Head of Data will be responsible for establishing and leading the company‚Äôs data strategy, governance, and analytics capabilities. This role will drive the transformation of our data assets into strategic business value by building a high-performing Data team, overseeing enterprise-wide data initiatives, and ensuring data architecture and analytics are scalable, secure, and aligned with business goals.

Strategy & Leadership
Define and lead the enterprise data strategy aligned with business and digital transformation goals.

Build and lead a cross-functional Data team (data engineering, data analytics, data governance, and data science).
Drive the adoption of data as a strategic asset across the organization, supporting functions such as Marketing, Operations, Supply Chain, Finance, and Customer Experience.
Collaborate with business stakeholders and technology teams to prioritize data initiatives and ensure ROI-driven execution.

Oversee the design, development, and optimization of the Enterprise Data Platform on Microsoft Azure and other cloud computing platforms

job_description:
We are looking for an experienced Oracle Database Administrator (DBA) to manage and optimize our Oracle database infrastructure. This role requires deep expertise in Oracle database administration, performance tuning, high availability configurations, and cloud migrations. You will be responsible for ensuring 24/7 database availability, security, and scalability while supporting business-critical applications and working closely with development teams.
1. RESPONSIBILITIES:
Database Administration & Operations
Manage, configure, and maintain Oracle 10g, 11g, 12c, 18c, 19c, 21c, and other enterprise Oracle database versons.
Ensure high availability, security, and performance tuning of production and development databases.
Monitor database health, troubleshoot issues, and implement proactive solutions to prevent downtime.
Manage database backup and recovery strategies, including RMAN, Data Guard, and Flashback technologies.
Performance Tuning & Optimization
Optimize SQL queries, indexing strategies, and database parameters to improve system performance.
Perform AWR, ASH, and ADDM analysis to diagnose and resolve performance bottlenecks.
Implement partitioning, compression, and parallel processing techniques for large datasets.
High Availability & Disaster Recovery
Design and implement Oracle Data Guard (Physical & Logical Standby), Oracle RAC (Real Application Clusters), and GoldenGate for high availability and disaster recovery.
Develop and test failover and disaster recovery plans to ensure business continuity.
Database Automation & Cloud Migration
Automate database tasks using PL/SQL, Shell scripting, Python, or Ansible.
Optimize storage, networking, and compute resources for on-premises Oracle deployments.
Security & Compliance
Implement database security best practices, including TDE (Transparent Data Encryption), auditing, and access control.
Ensure compliance with GDPR, PCI-DSS, and other industry regulations.
Others Role
Provide technical guidance to developers on database design, data modeling, and query optimization.
Collaborate with infrastructure, DevOps, and application teams to integrate databases into enterprise environments.
Document database architecture, configurations, and best practices for internal teams.

job_title: DevOps Engineer (Kubernetes, GCP, GitOps) Live Platform
job_description:
ABOUT US
We are building a large-scale real-time sports data platform serving millions of users daily, requiring ultra-low latency and high reliability.
Our entire backend infrastructure runs on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE).
As we transition toward a full GitOps model for infrastructure and application deployment, we are looking for a DevOps Engineer with strong expertise in Kubernetes, GCP, and GitOps (ArgoCD) to lead this automation transformation.
JOB OBJECTIVES
Implement and manage GitOps workflows: Use ArgoCD to synchronize Kubernetes application states with declarative configurations stored in Git.
Build a complete CI/CD system: Integrate CI pipelines (build, test, push image) with ArgoCD for secure and efficient continuous deployment.
Ensure consistency and traceability: Manage all infrastructure and application configurations as code (IaC/CaC) to enable auditing, versioning, and easy rollback.
Optimize and monitor infrastructure: Operate and tune GCP & GKE environments for performance, cost efficiency, and high availability ‚Äî especially for real-time workloads.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
1. GitOps & Deployment Management
Install, configure, and manage ArgoCD for end-to-end application lifecycle on GKE.
Design Git repository structures for manifests (Helm, Kustomize, YAML).
Set up auto-sync and alerting for out-of-sync changes between Git and live clusters.

2. CI/CD Automation
Build CI pipelines using GitLab CI or GitHub Actions to automatically build Docker images and push to Google Artifact Registry.
Integrate CI workflows to automatically update image tags in Git repositories, triggering ArgoCD deployments.

3. Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
Manage GCP resources (GKE, VPC, IAM) using Terraform.
Build and maintain secure, scalable Kubernetes clusters.

4. Monitoring, Optimization & Operations
Deploy monitoring and logging systems using Prometheus, Grafana, and Google Cloud Operations Suite.
Design effective auto-scaling strategies to handle real-time traffic spikes.
Conduct FinOps optimization to manage and reduce cloud costs.
Collaborate with the Backend Team to operate infrastructure for data pipelines and message queues (e.g., Google Pub/Sub, Kafka).
Ensure high availability (HA) and implement disaster recovery (DR) strategies.
your_skills_experience:
Hands-on experience deploying and operating applications on Kubernetes (GKE).
Strong practical experience with ArgoCD and GitOps workflows.
Proficiency in Terraform and Infrastructure as Code principles.
Experience building and integrating CI/CD pipelines with GitOps tools.
Knowledge of Helm or Kustomize for manifest management.
Proficiency in Docker and containerized application lifecycles.
Experience with CDN configuration and optimization (Cloudflare preferred).
Familiarity with message queues or streaming systems such as Google Pub/Sub or Kafka is a strong plus.
Understanding of cloud databases (Cloud SQL, Bigtable, Spanner) and monitoring tools (Prometheus, Grafana).

job_description:
About Galaxy Joy 
Galaxy Joy operates Vietnam's leading loyalty platform, powering the Vietjet SkyJoy program andconnecting over 250 brand partners across thecountry. As we expand across ASEAN,we're building a world-class data infrastructure from the ground up to support real-time transaction processing, partner integrations, and data-driven decision making at scale
Job Description: 
We're looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our growing data team and play a central role in transforming our data infrastructure into a modern, scalable platform. This is a hands-on leadership position where you'll own critical deliverables, drive architectural decisions, and help establish best practices as we build out our medallion architecture. You'll work across the full data stack, from ingestion and orchestration through transformation andanalytics, and have significant influence over how we design and operate our data platform.
1.Platform Modernization
You will drive the transformation of legacy systems into our modern data architecture. This includes championing engineering best practices such as code reviews, documentation, and testing, as well as mentoring junior team members andcontributing to building our data engineering culture.
2. Data Ingestion and Orchestration
You will design, develop, and maintain robust data pipelines using Apache Airflow and Python. This includes building and optimizing DAGs for ingesting data from brand partners with varying formats anddelivery methods. You'll ensure data quality and reliability at the point of ingestion with proper validation and error handling.
3. Data Transformation and Processing

Welcome to SMG Vietnam!
SMG Swiss Marketplace Group simplifies lives with innovative online marketplaces in Automotive, Real Estate, General Marketplaces, and Finance & Insurance. Fluency in English, written and verbal communication.

We are an innovative team of about 20 members, and we are willing to expand. Our team has been constantly growing since our inception in 2017 when we started trading on-chain. Our core activities revolve around trading on-chain and on centralized exchanges, monitoring trading operations from our applications, improving current systems in operational logic and technology frameworks, and designing new systems to adapt and stay ahead of market.
Each team member is assigned with multiple trading or helper applications/services that make our trading more efficient. There is a flat structure where your ideas and questions are always heard and each of the persons responsible for an app has autonomy and deep understanding of the trading needs and logic and can proactively suggest enhancements.
We are looking for someone who gets fascinated with the idea of diving deeper into trading, likes problems and also likes solving performance and algorithm challenges and is eager to exchange ideas in a competitive yet supportive environment aimed at personal and collective excellence. Aggregate and utilize above data effectively to support dynamic trading strategies.
Create reusable components to streamline trading strategy development and improve overall functionality.
Suggest algorithm enhancements based on a deep understanding of application requirements.
Leverage the latest open-source technologies to ensure the adoption of cutting-edge development practices.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer (PHP and English are a must)
job_description:
The Role
GeoComply is seeking a highly skilled Senior Software Engineer to join our team in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. 
As an Engineer at GeoComply, you can take project ownership, improve your design skills, and learn to communicate with various stakeholders to execute your plans. Your contributions will have a demonstrable positive impact on products and users.
In this role, you will be a key contributor to one of GeoComply's products, working closely with product managers and other experienced engineers to implement the product vision while ensuring that the code remains clean, maintainable, testable, and scalable.
As part of that challenge, you will provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior and mid-level developers within the team.
You will collaborate with engineers from adjacent teams: machine learning, data science, infrastructure, and other GeoComply products.
 Key Responsibilities
Build great software:
Analyze requirements, translate them into technical specifications, and estimate their implementation cost.
Be a strong individual contributor, actively writing (or teaching AI how to write) high-quality, maintainable, and scalable code.
Contribute to the technical roadmap:
Identify and prioritise problems, gaps and technical debt in the product.
Research and evaluate new tools, technologies and frameworks to enhance the product and improve development efficiency.
Actively ensure the product is technically prepared for future challenges, especially considering security, maintainability, and scalability.
Co-own the product:
At GeoComply, we emphasize the culture of ownership, so our engineers are empowered and encouraged to provide product development suggestions. 
Provide technical input and insights to Product Managers regarding tradeoffs between scope, engineering capacity, and time constraints.
Raise the quality bar for the team:
Champion best practices and actively participate in code and design document reviews to ensure high quality.
Mentor and support other engineers, fostering their growth and development.
Cross-team collaboration
Maintain communication with other technical teams to avoid duplicate effort, incompatible solutions and solving problems other teams have already resolved.
your_skills_experience:
Architecture & Modernization
Language Mastery & Transition: Possessing 5+ years of professional experience building complex enterprise web applications. You have deep expertise in PHP, but you are future-focused: you will play a key role in transforming our legacy PHP codebase into modern services powered by Golang.
Event-Driven & Async Communication: You have deep experience implementing Event-Driven Architecture to decouple systems. You are proficient with message brokers‚Äîspecifically AWS SQS (our primary driver) and Kafka‚Äîto orchestrate complex workflows between services.
Legacy Transformation: You have a proven track record of modernizing legacy systems. You know how to strangle a monolith and migrate functionality without breaking the existing business logic.
Design Mastery: You hold a mastery of OOP and SOLID principles and apply Domain-Driven Design (DDD) to organize complex logic effectively.
Operational Excellence & Quality
Observability First: You understand that code isn't "done" until it's observable in production. You implement comprehensive logging, distributed tracing, and monitoring strategies to ensure system health and facilitate rapid debugging.
Quality & Root Cause Focused: You go beyond basic metrics to focus on deep structural issues. You are willing to dig deep in search of root causes to ensure long-term system health rather than applying quick patches.
SDLC Expert: You possess a high-level understanding of the entire software development lifecycle, from requirement gathering down to deployment pipelines and infrastructure.
Collaboration & Leadership
API & Interoperability Specialist: You have experience designing clear, backward-compatible, and future-proof APIs. You are comfortable using gRPC for high-performance inter-service communication, as well as standard RESTful API practices.
Technical Team Player: You are able to make sound technical decisions, resolve technical conflicts within your scope, and effectively mentor other engineers through the technology transition.
Clear, Concise Communicator: You possess a high signal-to-noise ratio. You can communicate and collaborate effectively with engineers and non-technical audiences alike.
Proactive Problem Solver: You identify and troubleshoot technical challenges, using architectural foresight to avoid them before they reach production.
Our Tech Stack
Core Backend & Transition: We are currently running PHP (Laravel 11.x) and actively migrating performance-critical components to Golang. We also utilize Python and TypeScript where appropriate.
Infrastructure & Cloud: AWS (focusing on SQS & EventBridge for async workflows, S3), Docker, Kubernetes, and ArgoCD for GitOps deployments.
Data & Search: MongoDB, Elasticsearch, and DataBricks.
Observability: Grafana and Prometheus for real-time monitoring and metrics.
Bonus Points
Experience with working with strongly structured languages (java, kotlin, C#)
Experience with cloud solutions (GCP, AWS)
Front-end experience (React, Typescript)
Experience or having domain knowledge in online payment, eCommerce, credit card processing, risk management, or fraud detection

1. THE ROLE OVERVIEW
We are seeking a Technical Product Owner to serve as the primary bridge between our US Product Team and the Vietnam Engineering Team. This is a dynamic, high-impact role that requires wearing multiple hats: Product Owner, Scrum Master, and Project Manager. You will not just manage a backlog; you will own the delivery of a complex healthcare product that supports children with autism. Our US Partner ‚ÄúCloud Kinetix‚Äù is proud to be the technology hub for a U.S.-based healthcare company pioneering software solutions for individuals with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and intellectual developmental disabilities (IDD). Our lean engineering team in Vietnam collaborates directly with product and engineering leaders in the U.S. to create smart, secure, and scalable clinical platforms. 
 2. WORKING SCHEDULE & EXPECTATIONS (Please Read Carefully)
To ensure effective collaboration with the US team, this position operates on a specific schedule. We value transparency and want to ensure this aligns with your lifestyle before you apply:
Early Schedule: Work starts at 6:00 AM (Vietnam Time) on remote days (Tue-Fri) to facilitate direct syncs with US stakeholders.

job_description:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Crossian is a high-growth technology-driven e-commerce business. Behind our success is our people. As a start-up formed in 2020, we have created a fast-paced and dynamic environment, enabling our people to reach $100 million of revenue in 2024, a cumulative average growth rate of over 1000% in just under 4 years. Our mission now is to harness the power of technology to develop a direct-to-consumer approach and enhance customer lifetime value.
As part of Technology Innovations Department, you'll work in a Agile, and tech-startup environment inspired by Unicorn worthy culture.
We are seeking an experienced IT Support Specialist to oversee our IT support and office admin operations and ensure the 24/7 excellence of our cloud-based software systems. Reporting to the Line Manager and collaborating closely with the CEO/HR admin team to provide services to the whole company, you will be a member of 4 IT Support Specialists responsible for monitoring system health, troubleshooting issues, and providing first-level support to internal and external users. This role is critical in maintaining the robustness of our systems and supporting the productivity of our team in a dynamic, agile environment.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Support Operations: Ensure efficient handling of first-level support requests via communication channels such as Slack and phone, escalating complex issues to the technical team.
System Monitoring: Oversee active monitoring of system dashboards, alerts, and infrastructure boards on platforms like Grafana and AWS to proactively identify and address issues.
After-Hours Coordination: Organize and participate in rotation schedules for after-hours system monitoring to guarantee continuous platform operation.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of support activities, resolutions, and preventive measures to build a robust knowledge base.
Software Support: Oversee support for office software and applications, manage user access, and ensure optimal usage practices.
Infrastructure Management: Maintain the reliability and security of office network infrastructure, including Wi-Fi, routers, switches, and hardware like printers, laptops, and TVs.

Kinis.ai is a science-based digital health company building Movement Intelligence technology to help adults 50+ maintain independence and prevent mobility decline. 1. JOB PURPOSE
Design, implement, and optimize data processing pipelines from multiple sources (UAV, IoT, GIS, operational systems, etc.), ensuring that data is cleaned, standardized, and stored according to required specifications for AI, simulation, analytics, and other applications. Act as a technical bridge between data collection and data-consuming teams.
2. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Design and implement ETL/ELT workflows for diverse data sources.
Perform data cleaning, standardization, integration, and handle data errors or missing values.
Build and manage relational (SQL) and non-relational (NoSQL) databases.
Optimize processing performance to reduce loading time and storage costs.
Develop scripts or automation processes to improve data processing efficiency.
Ensure data security, integrity, and accessibility.
Collaborate with the QA team to verify and validate data quality before delivery.
Support root cause analysis for data-related incidents and propose corrective solutions.

job_description:
We are looking for enthusiastic and dedicated operation engineers to help support, maintain, monitor and improve the infrastructure and code building and deployment process for our development teams. At the same time, the operation team plays a vital role to ensure smooth product experience for our customers. 
What you will do
You will be responsible for maintaining our Linux and Windows servers in all environments (production, staging or development). Ensuring the servers are in good working condition (with enough RAM, CPU, etc..). 
You will learn to use tools such as Ansible and our CI/CD pipeline to automate our deployment of our services and maintenance of our servers. 
You will learn and understand the architecture and details (services, relation among services, etc....) of our products to perform first level support for our customers. 
You will further improve our CI/CD pipeline and make changes to satisfy the deployment requirements from our dev teams. 
You will find out the current issues and optimize our infrastructure and deployment processes. 
You will communicate with our customers when needed to resolve issues or escalate the issues to our other development teams. 
You will keep track of and report the production, and deployment issues to the management team.

Strong understanding of Linux operating systems including maintaining server, software installation, log management, service monitoring and management, firewall management, etc.. 
Experience with build/continuous integration tools such as Jenkins and GitLab. 
Experience with modern build systems such as Gradle. 
Experience with using Git. 
Experience of managing the full lifecycle of the Build, Test and Release process of web applications. 
Experience with AWS or other cloud providers.

Strong communication and management skills.

job_description:
As a Senior Software Engineer - Front End, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining the user interfaces for our platform. You will work on innovative and challenging projects, creating intuitive and engaging user experiences that leverage the power of AI. You will work closely with backend engineers, data scientists, product managers, and designers to build a world-class platform. You will be a hands-on developer, writing high-quality code and contributing to architectural decisions.
Key responsibilities
Frontend Development:
Design, develop, and maintain user interfaces for the AI agent platform using modern web technologies (e.g., React, Vue.js, or Angular).
Write high-quality, well-tested, maintainable, and reusable code.
Implement responsive and accessible user interfaces.
Optimize frontend performance for speed and scalability.
AI/ML Integration (UI Focus):
Work closely with backend engineers and data scientists to integrate AI/ML-powered features into the user interface.
Develop UI components and interactions that effectively present AI-driven insights, recommendations, and actions to users.
Visualize complex data and AI model outputs in a user-friendly way.
Real-Time Communication:
Collaborate with data engineers to integrate the AI agent platform with data pipelines for training and inference.
Work with various data storage technologies (SQL, NoSQL, data warehouses).
UI/UX Best Practices:
Champion UI/UX best practices and ensure a consistent and user-friendly experience across the platform.
Work closely with designers to implement UI designs and prototypes.
Testing:
Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to ensure the quality and reliability of the frontend code.
Mentorship:
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior engineers.
Technology Evaluation:
Evaluate and investigate technology to improve UI/UX for AI agent platform.

Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience:
Minimum of 5+ years of experience in frontend software engineering.
Strong experience with modern JavaScript frameworks/libraries (React preferred, Vue.js or Angular are also acceptable).
Experience with TypeScript is a strong plus.
Experience with building complex, data-rich web applications.
Experience with real-time communication technologies (WebSockets) is a plus.
Experience with state management libraries (e.g., Redux, Zustand, Vuex, Pinia).
Experience with testing frameworks (e.g., Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress, Playwright).
Experience with UI component libraries (e.g., Material UI, Ant Design) is a plus.
Experience with data visualization libraries (e.g., D3.js, Chart.js) is a plus.
Experience with integrating with RESTful APIs and GraphQL.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines.
Experience working in an Agile environment.
Familiarity with AI/ML concepts and technologies is a significant plus, but not strictly required (the ability and willingness to learn is essential).

 We are looking for a highly skilled Senior System Engineer (Senior DevOps & SRE) to join our Engineering team. You will be responsible for designing, automating, securing, and operating our multi-cloud infrastructure across AWS and Alibaba Cloud.
You will work closely with backend, data, and security teams to ensure the reliability, scalability, and performance of our systems. This role requires strong hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform), CI/CD (Jenkins, ArgoCD), security scanning tools (SonarQube, Snyk, Trivy), and system configuration using Ansible.

Develop SLOs/SLIs, alerting rules, dashboards, and incident response processes.
Lead root-cause analysis, performance optimizations, and reliability improvements.
4. Configuration Management & Automation
Use Ansible to automate setup, provisioning, patching, and configuration of services on EC2.
Maintain automation playbooks for internal tools, backend services, and critical system components.
5. Security & Compliance
Integrate SonarQube, Snyk, Trivy scanning into CI/CD workflows.
Ensure container, infrastructure, and pipeline security alignment with best practices.
Work with the security team on vulnerability management and remediation.
6. Collaboration
Partner with engineering leads to design scalable architectures.
Mentor junior DevOps/SRE engineers and enforce best practices.
Drive continuous improvement in DevOps maturity, automation, and reliability.

job_description:
About the Role
We are looking for an experienced Senior Cloud Engineer with a strong background in AWS infrastructure design, deployment, and operations. The ideal candidate has a solid understanding of AWS core services, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Kubernetes (EKS), and modern cloud automation practices. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable, secure, and cost-efficient cloud environments across multiple AWS accounts.
Responsibilities
Design, implement, and manage AWS cloud infrastructure following best practices for scalability, availability, and security.
Operate and maintain AWS environments in multi-account setups using AWS Organizations, IAM, and cross-account role management.
Deploy, manage, and optimize EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service) clusters for containerized workloads.
Implement infrastructure provisioning and lifecycle management using Terraform, CloudFormation, or AWS CDK.
Automate configuration management, application deployment, and system updates using Ansible or Chef.
Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize performance and cost of AWS services such as EC2, S3, RDS, and VPC networking.
Collaborate with developers, DevOps, and security teams to deliver reliable and secure cloud platforms.
Maintain and improve CI/CD pipelines and GitOps workflows for cloud resources and Kubernetes clusters.
Ensure compliance with security and governance standards across all AWS accounts.
Provide technical guidance, documentation, and mentoring to junior engineers when needed.
your_skills_experience:
3+ years of hands-on experience managing AWS cloud environments in production.
Strong understanding of AWS core services: EC2, VPC, S3, RDS, IAM, EKS, CloudWatch, and Route53.
Experience operating EKS clusters and Kubernetes workloads, including deployment, scaling, and troubleshooting.
Proficiency in at least one programming or scripting language (e.g., Python, Go, or Bash).
Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, or AWS CDK.
Familiarity with configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible, Chef).
Solid knowledge of Linux system administration and shell scripting.
Experience working in multi-account AWS environments using AWS Organizations, Control Tower, or custom account management setups.
Good understanding of cloud networking concepts, including VPC, subnets, route tables, and security groups.
Strong problem-solving mindset and ability to work independently with high ownership and accountability.
Excellent communication and documentation skills in English.
Nice to Have
AWS certification (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect ‚Äì Associate/Professional, DevOps Engineer, or SysOps Administrator).
Experience with monitoring and observability tools (Prometheus, Grafana, CloudWatch, OpenTelemetry).
Knowledge of CI/CD systems (e.g., GitHub Actions, Jenkins, GitLab CI).
Exposure to cost optimization, tagging strategies, or FinOps practices.

job_description:
HRS AS A COMPANY
HRS is transforming the future of corporate travel through innovative technology. In a $600 billion global lodging and meetings market, inefficiencies are rampant‚Äîfrom frustrating traveler experiences caused by outdated check-in and payment systems to millions lost annually due to missing or non-compliant invoices that block VAT reclaim. With travel increasingly complex and fragmented, the opportunity for innovation is enormous‚Äîand HRS is leading the charge. 
 HRS offers an unparalleled end-to-end solution for managing corporate lodging, group travel, long stay, and meetings‚Äîall within a single, unified platform. With HRS Connect, companies gain access to a sleek, consumer-grade booking interface that consolidates fragmented travel spend and delivers full visibility across all travel categories. This is paired with HRS‚Äôs proprietary AI Copilot, which enables travel and procurement leaders to steer their programs strategically with real-time data, actionable insights, and one-click implementation of optimizations. 
 Together, these solutions empower organizations to drive measurable cost savings, boost policy compliance, and radically improve the traveler experience. The HRS platforms enable customers to achieve up to 3x return on investment, achieve close to 100% invoice compliance, and increase corporate program adoption by over 20% ‚Äî which is particularly relevant in unmanaged spend areas like meetings and groups.   
 With over two decades of proprietary data, market-leading AI, and deep integration across the travel and expense ecosystem, HRS powers travel programs for 35% of the Fortune 500. From seamless payment to e-invoicing to VAT reclaim, HRS offers unmatched transparency, governance, and performance ‚Äî turning travel into a data-driven advantage with a sharp focus on customer excellence, compliance, and automation. 
 BUSINESS UNIT
Search & Book is at the core of HRS‚Äôs value proposition - simplifying how employees book hotels and meeting spaces, increasing program adoption, and delivering full transparency across lodging and meetings spend. Key HRS innovations such as AI-powered search, real-time rate validation, and multi-source content integration ensure travelers always see the most relevant, compliant, and cost-effective options. 
 These capabilities not only improve traveler satisfaction and policy compliance but also play a central role in enabling HRS‚Äôs go-to-market strategy. Search & Book strengthens our global content ecosystem‚Äîunlocking network effects that drive scalability, data quality, and continuous optimization across the platform. Search & Book doesn‚Äôt just support the travel experience; it powers the intelligent discovery and selection layer that connects every stay and meeting in one seamless flow. 
 As a member of the Search & Book team, you‚Äôll work at the intersection of user experience, content intelligence, and global supply. You‚Äôll help some of the world‚Äôs leading enterprises deliver smarter, more sustainable ways to stay and meet‚Äîwith visibility, personalization, and control at every step. 
 POSITION
As a key member of Search & Book team, you‚Äôll design intuitive, seamless experiences that serve the diverse needs of corporate travellers, travel agents, and meeting planners. From web tools to APIs, you'll craft solutions that simplify complex journeys and scale globally. 
 You‚Äôll partner closely with product managers, engineers, marketers, and sales teams to turn insights into powerful, user-centred products. You will be at the forefront of tackling the usability risk - ensuring our products not only work but are intuitive, efficient, and impactful for customers. Through close collaboration, strategic design, and user-driven insights, you will help shape products that deliver measurable value to both users and the business.   
 CHALLENGE
As a Product Designer in our Search & Book vertical, you will shape next-generation, AI-first user experiences that make business travel feel effortless, intuitive, and intelligently guided. Your mission is to design interfaces and interactions that empower users to book with confidence and delight ‚Äî all while advancing HRS‚Äôs global vision of seamless, data-driven travel. 
 You will: 
Own usability and simplicity: Design ‚ÄúApple-esque‚Äù experiences that transform complex booking flows into clear, elegant, and emotionally engaging interactions across transient, group, meeting, and long-stay journeys. 
Design intelligent, data-driven interfaces: Leverage data, market benchmarks, and customer criteria to build adaptive, context-aware experiences (e.g., guided supplier quotations and dynamic recommendations). 
Build AI-first user journeys: Apply generative and predictive AI design patterns that anticipate user intent, minimize friction, and continuously learn from usage data. 
Drive measurable business impact: Use funnel analytics, conversion metrics, and satisfaction data to improve repeat usage, cross-segment adoption, and time-to-booking. 
Deliver design with integrity and velocity: Operate with a high level of accountability, producing timely, high-quality designs that are ready for production in committed project cycles. 
Balance short- and long-term design horizons: 
H1 (Now): Deliver tangible design output for current initiatives.
H2 (Next): Validate and prepare future opportunities through research and prototyping.
H3 (Later): Contribute to long-term design vision, exploration, and innovation. 
Accelerate time-to-revenue: Organize your design process for maximum go-to-market speed, leveraging rapid prototyping, LLM-assisted design tools, and customer/partner co-creation. 
Expand our knowledge base: Develop and maintain a growing repository of LLM-based user personas, ensuring research insights scale across teams and markets. 
Collaborate as part of the Product Trio: Partner with Product and Engineering to validate hypotheses, iterate on solutions, and ensure every release drives both user and business value.

Align with stakeholders (Product, Business, Security, Engineering) to ensure shared understanding and buy-in on solution direction.

Experience with web or mobile business applications in cloud environments is highly preferred, along with a solid understanding of web, mobile, and database technologies and the stages of modern application development.

As an Associate Product Owner, you will collaborate closely with key stakeholders,and technical teams to ensure the successful design and delivery of solutions that align with business goals.

Acceptance and Quality Assurance: Coordinate or conduct User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to verify that completed features meet agreed acceptance criteria, business objectives, and quality standards.

job_description:
Lead data engineers at Thoughtworks develop modern data architecture approaches to meet key business objectives and provide end-to-end data solutions. They might spend a few weeks with a new client on a deep technical review or a complete organizational review, helping them to understand the potential that data brings to solve their most pressing problems. On projects, they will be leading the design of technical solutions, or perhaps overseeing a program inception to build a new product. Alongside hands-on coding, they are leading the team to implement the solution.
 Job responsibilities
You will lead and manage data engineering projects from inception to completion, including goal-setting, scope definition and ensuring on-time delivery with cross team collaboration.
You will collaborate with stakeholders to understand their strategic objectives and identify opportunities to leverage data and data quality.
You will design, develop and operate modern data architecture approaches to meet key business objectives and provide end-to-end data solutions.

AI/Tech Understanding

Evaluate new AI technologies, model providers, and integrations to enhance product capability.

Collaborate with Data Scientists and Engineers to ensure smooth and proper production implementation.
